docs.lead_paragraph: A couple who fled Belarus after the fall of the Soviet Union ended up in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, but have struggled with health problems and limited income.

headline.seo: Love Endures Amid an Immigrant Odyssey and Health Problems

docs.abstract: Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens provides funds for Galina and Grigory Bobarykin of Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, to buy an air conditioner for their small apartment.

docs.lead_paragraph: The election of Tammy Baldwin as the country’s first openly gay senator this week came only six years after Wisconsin voted down a gay marriage initiative.

headline.seo: Fickle Wisconsin Sends Tammy Baldwin, Trusty Progressive, to Senate
headline.main: Fickle Wisconsin Sends a Trusty Progressive to the Senate
headline.print_headline: Fickle Wisconsin Sends a Trusty Progressive to the Senate

docs.abstract: Election of Rep Tammy Baldwin, seven-term Democrat from Madison, Wis, makes her the country's first openly gay senator; hard-fought win is testament to unorthodox politics of a state known for its wide ideological swings and affirmation of her starkly progressive views.
docs.snippet: The election of Tammy Baldwin as the country’s first openly gay senator this week came only six years after Wisconsin voted down a gay marriage initiative.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration announced Friday that it would extend the deadline for states to submit their plans for health insurance exchanges.

headline.seo: U.S. Extends Deadline on Health Coverage for States
headline.main: U.S. Extends a Deadline for States on Coverage
headline.print_headline: U.S. Extends A Deadline For States On Coverage

docs.abstract: Obama administration, with many states lagging far behind schedule, says it will extend deadline for them to submit plans for health insurance exchanges, online markets where millions of Americans are expected to obtain private coverage subsidized by federal government.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration announced Friday that it would extend the deadline for states to submit their plans for health insurance exchanges.

headline.main: More Time to Enroll in Medicare If You Live in Storm Areas

docs.abstract: Federal officials have extended the Dec. 7 deadline to enroll in a private medical or drug plan for next year for those still coping with storm damage.

docs.lead_paragraph: After years of political and legal threats that kept President Obama’s health care law in a state of uncertainty, his re-election all but assures it will survive. The next hurdle is making it work.

headline.seo: States Rush to Meet Tight Health Care Deadlines
headline.main: With Obama Re-elected, States Scramble Over Health Law
headline.print_headline: Election Over, States Race On Deadlines In Health Law

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's re-election all but guarantees that his health care law will survive, after nearly three years of legal and political threats that kept the legislation in uncertainty; election came just 10 days before critical deadline for states in carrying out the law, and many that were waiting for outcome must now hustle to comply.
docs.snippet: After years of political and legal threats that kept President Obama’s health care law in a state of uncertainty, his re-election all but assures it will survive. The next hurdle is making it work.

headline.main: Why Studies That Compare Treatments Lack Impact

docs.abstract: Studies that gauge one treatment against another have received a lot of attention and federal support, but doctors have been slow to incorporate the findings, a new analysis shows.
docs.snippet: Studies that gauge one treatment against another have received a lot of attention and federal support, but doctors have been slow to incorporate the findings, a new analysis shows.

headline.main: Setting the Table for Tax Negotiations

docs.abstract: The government can address the so-called fiscal cliff through more progressive spending, not higher tax rates, the author writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Going into the election, Republican candidates knew they faced obstacles with minorities and women, but candidates’ comments on rape were not among them.

headline.seo: Women’s Issues Were a Problem for G.O.P.
headline.main: Senate Races Expose Extent of Republicans’ Gender Gap
headline.print_headline: Senate Races Expose Extent Of Republicans’ Gender Gap

docs.abstract: Comments by two Republican Senate candidates concerning pregnancies that result from rape are said to have derailed party's hopes of gaining seats in the Senate; shortfall highlights gender gap Republican Party has with female voters as the controversial remarks on rape and abortion drowned out other messages.
docs.snippet: Going into the election, Republican candidates knew they faced obstacles with minorities and women, but candidates’ comments on rape were not among them.
